Cable Address: INDEVAS November 27, 2012 Mr. Scott Dawson First Assistant Director Genei-al South and West Asia Divisio!i AusAID 255 London Circuit Canberra, ACT 2600 Australia Trust Fund Administration Agreement between the Government of Australia, acting through the Australian Agency for International Development and tL e International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the Inter national Development Association concerning the Multi-Donor Trust Fund for the South Asia Water Initiative Phase-2 (Trust Fund No.TF071929), A1sA D Agreement 63224 Dear Mr. Dawson: 1. We are pleased to acknowledge on behalf of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Devel,praent ("IBRD") and the International Development Association ("IDA") (collective Ly, t le "Bank") that the Government of Australia, acting through the Australian Ager cy for International Development (AusAID) (the "Donor") shall make available as i :,ran: the sum of eight million Australian Dollars (AUD8,000,000.00) (the "Contribut ion") for the Multi-Donor Trust Fund for the South Asia Water Initiative Phase-: Tiust . 'und (the "Trust Fund") in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, Other doiors ar: also expected to contribute to the Trust Fund on the terms and conditions specified in the Annexes to this Agreement. 2. The Contribution shall be used to finance the activities and the categories of expenditure set forth in the "Desc -iption of Activities, Expenditures and Governance Arrangements under the Multi- Dor or Trust Fund for the South Asia Water Initiative Pha;e-2 Trust Fund" attache, I h-ereto as Annex 1, and shall be administered by the Bank on I:ehalf of the Donor in z ccorda ice with the terms of this Agreement including the "Staidard Provisions Applicable to 1 he Multi-Donor Trust Fund for the South Asia Water Initiative Phase-2 Trust Fund" (the "Standard Provisions") attached hereto as Annex 2. 3. The Donor shall dep )sil the Contribution into such bank account designated by the Bank in installments in a(cordan-:e with the following schedule:
ï»¿-2- (a) promptly 'ollowinig countersignature of this Agreement by the Donor and submission of a payment request by the Bank, two million Australian Dollars (AUD 2,000,000), (b) on or before 15 Febru iry 2014, three million Australian Dollars (AUD 3,000,000) and submissic n of a payment request by the Bank; and (c) on or before 15 F ,bru ry 2015 three million Australian Dollars (AUD 3,000,000) and su6missic n of a payment request by the Bank. 4. When making each deposit, the Donor shall instruct its bank to include in its payment details information (rcmitiance advice) field of its SWIFT payment message, information indicating: the imount paid, that the payment is made by the Donor for TFO71929 (the South Asia Weter nitiative Phase-2 Trust Fund), and the date of the deposit (the "Deposit Instru(tion"). In addition, the Donor shall provide a copy of the Donor's Deposit Instruction to the Bank's Accounting Trust Funds Division by e-mail sent to tfremitadvide@worldlhank.or:; or by fax sent to (202) 614-1315. 5. The Bank shall conNert the Contribution funds into the holding currency of the Trust Fund, namely United States Dollars, promptly upon receipt of the Contribution funds and the Deposit Instruction containing the information specified in paragraph 4 at the exchange rate obtained by the Bank on the date of the conversion. Where the Coriiribution proves to be ins uff [ciet t to complete the activities as a result of an exchange rate fluctuation, neither the B anl: noi the Donor shall bear any responsibility for providing any additional financi:ag. 6. Except as provided foi in paragraph 4 above, any notice, request or other communication to be given or m!de under this Agreement shall be in writing and delivered by mail, facsimile or c-ma .1 to the respective party's address specified below or at such other address as such party n )tifies in writing to the other party from time to time: For the Bank: Ms. Geneviev, Connors Senior Water Re,,ources Specialist, SASDI The World Banik HT (H' ndusta 1 T [me.) ï»¿-3- For the Donor Mr. Russell RAhson First Secretar) AusAID New Delhi Austraian High Commission 1/50 G Shanti-ath, Clianakyapuri New Delhi 11 )K1 IDIA Tel: +9111 449 4465 Fax: +9111 2688 7492 E-mail: Russe .l.rollas on@dfat.gov.au 7. All annexes hereto conslitut( an integral part of this Agreement. This Agreement may be amended only in writing b tween the Bank and the Donor; provided, however, that such annexes may be amenled )nly with the agreement of all donors contributing to the Trust Fund. 8. Please confirm your agieem ent with the foregoing, on behalf of the Donor, by signing, dating, and retuminj to us t 4e enclosed copy of this Agreement. Upon receipt by the Bank of the copy of t1lis Agr :ement countersigned by you, this Agreement will become effective as of the dai:e of thi countersignature. ï»¿-4- ANNEX 1 Descriptionof ctivities and Ext enditures and Governance Arrangements under the Souih Asia Wite r In tiative Phase-2 Multi-Donor Trust Fund This Annex s'lall be ap plic ble to and form an integral part of all agreements entered into between the Banl< an I entities (collectively, the "Donors") that provide contributions (the aggregate of 11 c.ntributions from the Donors, the "Contributions") to be administered by the Bank bar the Trust Fund. A. DESCRIPTION OF ACTIVI IES The Project Developne at (lbjective is to increase regional cooperation in the mariagement of the Himalayan Riv:-r systems to deliver sustainable, fair and inclusive development and climate resilience. (i) Ba k-Execut,-d,Tru!,t Fund Activities: SAWI will support activities relating to the management of river basins rising in the Greater Himalayas, in the co intr: es of Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, China, India, Nepal and Pakistan. The program will be structured around five key Focus Areas: the Ganges Basin, the Brahmaputra Ba. in, the Indus Basin, the Sundarbans Landscape, and Regional Cooperation. Speci:ic outp its and the outcomes to which they contribute will be iderlified in the Focus AreE Sirate)ries at the basin, sub-basin/landscape, and regional levels. At the Program level there will be two inter-related components: Component 1: Building Coof erztion and Governance Systematic dialogue (e.g., policy aiid practice debates engaging governments, opinion- makers, civil society, privale ,ectc r and media) will be facilitated on transboundary opportunities and policy developm nt at the regional and national levels, and among development partners. Effor s will :e made to reach out to women and disadvantaged groups in order to ensure that c )ncerns and opportunities relating to gender and inclusiveness are identifie. The se dialogues will lead to improved common understanding, better priority ,ettig, greater stakeholder ownership of interventions, enabled policy environments. and ca.1s for action. Learning: Capacity Building. Prioritized shared learning activities will be delivered to build capacity and skills, and tc off,-r opportunities for regional practitioners to develop de f1acto networks of practice. F articularly in fragile states, SAWI will support activities to enhance the capacity of officials and other stakeholders to manage water (e.g., flood forecasting, institutional deve-lopment, basin modeling) and to engage in transboundary activities (e.g., international water law, negotiations.) These efforts will contribute to more effective engagement on trar sboundary issues, better management practices and more successful implementation of r elated activities.
ï»¿-5- Component 2: Supporting KrowledEe and Investments Knowledge: Analysis and Pc licy Dt velopment. High quality, policy relevant knowledge bases will be built in at least thrce important basins or landscapes. The process of knowledge developirent and Jisscmination will be emphasized to ensure quality, ownership and uptake, and S kVWI di alogues will be used as key platforms for knowledge sharing. Accessibility (e.g., cpe:i ac.ess data platforms) will also be emphasized. These effoits will contribute to m:re informed policy debates, greater legitimacy of positions/decision taken and betier d,-signed interventions. Action: Investment Design, Five genuine transboundary reform processes and/or investments will be supportOd. Gr( at potential exists in the region for transboundary cooperation on water resources rela:ed opportunities and risks at different levels: at the regional (e.g., hydro meteorcilot:ical information, disaster risk management, hydropower development), river basin (e.g., intcgrated river basin management, conjunctive use of surface and groundwater, se dirent management) and landscape levels (e.g., glaciers, mangroves). These actions m ou .d contribute to greater sustainability and productivity of rivers and ecosystems, the prctect on of lives and livelihoods against disasters, and enhanced resilience to climal e c hani ;e. Potentially, these efforts could also help diminish regional tensions around tran.,;bounda Lry waters. (ii) Re$ipient-Exocuted [rust Fund Activities: Supporting the client cointri -s in specific activities to be carried out in line with enhancing their capacity and in coniributing to the SAWI-2 objectives, including: pilots, capacity building, study tours, resezrch grants, show cases, exchange of knowledge and best practice on specific issues relev; nt to SAWI-2. B. CATEGORIES OF EXPE NDI TURE (i) For Bank-Exe zuted at.tivities the Contributions may be used to finance: (a) associated overhead; (b) consultant fees individuals and firms; (c) contractual services; (d) equipment and office prei nis es kase cost; (e) extended term consultants-No indirects; (f) extended terms consultents; (g) field assignment benefits; (h) media, workshop, conference and meeting; (i) staff costs - with indirect costs; (j) staff costs - no indirect costs; (k) temporary support !taff cots; and (1) travel expenses. (ii) For Recipier -Execu ted activities, the Contributions may be used to finance: (a) civil works; (1) consliltant services; (c) goods; (d) operating costs; (e) training; and (f) grants. The foregoing categories of expe aditures may include the financing of taxes.
ï»¿-6- C. GOVERNANCE ST RL CT JRE An annual meeting of the MDTF Committee (SAWI Partners) will review progress, update and approve the Fo,,us Area Strategies, and finalize an Annual Report. It will assess progress against phanne i results and consider what changes are needed to max'mize the likelihood that Lng term outcome indicators are achieved. Within the components, the decision on allocalion of funds will be based on Focal Area Strategies and understandings reached c uriag tie annual meeting of the MDTF Committee. The World Bank wi 1 lie rmsponsible for the day-to-day administration of the MDTF in accordance with admit istration arrangements with SAWI partners. The responsibility of 'no-objectioi i' to act vities rests with the World Bank. The overall MDTF will be supervised by the EAVI 'eam Leader/TF Manager, reporting directly to the SASDI Sector Manager. The SAWI Team Leader/TF Manager and SASDI Sector Manager will process all pro osals in accordance with required fiduciary procedures and the objectives of the Trust Ftind Individual Focus Area Leaders will be appointed and be responsible for the developnient of the Focus Area Strategy and for reporting on implementation progress. Inc ividual Task Team Leaders will manage each grant funded acti1ity supported by Ihe Tru!:t Fund
ï»¿-7- ANNEX 2 Standard Provision s Applica ble Io the South Asia Water Initiative Phase-2 Multi- ]Donor Trust Fund This Annex s'all be ap plicable to and form an integral part of all agreements entered into between the 3ark and the Donors that provide Contributions to be administered by the Bank for the TIL st Fund. 1. Administration of the Contril iutions 1.1. The Bank shall be res poiisibl e only for performing those functions specifically set forti in this Agreement and ;hall nc t be subject to any other duties or responsibilities to the Donors, including, witho at I imil ation, any duties or obligations that might otherwise apply to a fiduciary or trustee under general principles of trust or fiduciary law. Nothing in this Agreement shall be con3ide:ed a waiver of any privileges or immunities of the IBR) and IDA under their A rticles f Agreement or any applicable law, all of which are exp:essly reserved. 1.2. The Contribution shal1 be administered in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures, as 1 he sarr e may be amended from time to time, including its framework to preveni and combat I raud and corruption and its screening procedures to prevent the use of Bank resources to finance terrorist activity, in line with the Bank's obligations to give effect to the relevant decisions of the Security Council, taken under Chapter VII of the of Charte o:' the United Nations. The Donor acknowledges that this provision does not create any cblig itions of the Bank under the anti-terrorist financing and asset control laws, regulations, rules and executive orders of an individual member country that may apply to the Donor, nor shall it be deemed a waiver, express or implied, of any of the privileges and iiamunit es of the Bank. 2. Commingling, Excha ige and Investment of the Contributions 2.1. The Contributions shll be accounted for as a single trust fund and shall be kept separate and apart from the 'unIs of the Bank. The Contributions may be commingled with other trust fund assets r aintain d by the Bank. 2.2. The Contributions may be fi eely exchanged by the Bank into other currencies as may facilitate their disbursenien. 2.3. The Bank sha.1 invest and rminvest the Contributions pending their disbursement in accordance with the Bank's policies and procedures for the investment of trust funds administered by the Bank. The Bank shall credit all income from such investment to the Trust Fund to be used for the same p arposes as the Contributions.
ï»¿-8- 3. Administr4tive Cost Lecover y 3.1 In order to assist in the- dc frayment of the costs of administration and other expenses incurred by the Bar k t nde - this Agreement, the Bank may deduct and retain for its own account an amount equal 1o two percent (2%) of each Contribution from the Contributions. In addition, costs for program management and administration up to a max1mum of 7% will be char,zec. to I [e Trust Fund on an actual basis. If the contributions increase beyond what was or ginally expected at the time of counter-signature of the first administration agreement, arid 1he administrative costs increase as a result, the Donors acknowledge that an additional ,dministrative fee may be applied to such new coniributions. 4. Grants to Recipients 4.1. The Bank shall, as ad miiistr itor of the Trust Fund on behalf of the Donors, enter into grant agreements (the "Grant Agreements") 'with eligible recipients selected in accordance with the governa ce ten.is of Annex 1 (the "Recipients") consistent with the purposes of this Agieement and on the terms and conditions set forth in the Grant Agreements. Grant Agreemcnt,, may be entered into up to the maximum amount of the Contributions that all Donois have agreed to make available under the Administration Agreements between :he Bark and tie Donors. Upon request by a Donor, the Bank shall furnish a copy of the Grant Agreeme 'it to the Donors. 4.2. The Bank shall be respo:isib e for the supervision of the activities financed under the Grant Agreements. Sub ecl to he consent of the Recipients, representatives of the Donors may be invited by thc B ink :o participate in Bank supervision missions related to the Trust Fund. 4.3. The Bank shall promptly infi irm the Donors of any significant modification to the terms of any Grant Agreeme its and of any contractual remedies that are exercised by the Bank under any Grant Agrectments. To the extent practicable, the Bank shall afford the Donors the opportunity to exciange views before effecting any such modification or exercising any such remedy. 4.4. The Bank shall include a pr )vision in each Grant Agreement that the Recipient will: (i) not use the proceeds of the grant for the purposes of any payment to persons or entities, or for the import of goo Is, if such payment or import, to the Recipient's knowledge or belief, is prohibiled by decisions of the United Nations Security Council take under Chapter V] I of the Cliarte r of the United Nations, and if applicable, (b) include a corresponding provision in any sul b-grant agreements that the Recipient enters into with entities to which the Recipienit make; the grant funding available.
ï»¿-9- 5. Procurement 5.1. For Recipient.-execut,l acti,rities, the Grant Agreements shall provide that the Contributions shall be used by the Recipients to finance expenditures for goods and services, as the case may be, in accordance with the Bank's Guidelines on "Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credit ;" and the Bank's Guidelines on the "Selection and Employment of Cons-iltants by Woild Bank Borrowers," as in effect at the date of entry into the respective Grnmt Agr,,enent;. 5.2. For Bank-executed activities, the employment and supervision of any consultants and the procurement of zny goods financed by the Contributions shall be the resrionsibility of the Bank ind shall be carried out in accordance with its applicable policies and procedures. 6. Accounting and Finarcial Reporting 6.1. The Bank shall main tain separate records and ledger accounts in respect of the Contributions deposited in th - Trust Fund account and disbursements made therefrom. 6.2. The Bank shall furn sh to the Donors current financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fUnd ba ance in the holding currency of the Trust Fund with respect to the Contributions via th . World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. Within six (6) moni hs aftei all commitments and liabilities under the Trust Fund have been satisfied and the Frust Fund has been closed, the final financial information relating to receipts, di sbursei nr ts a id fund balance in the holding currency of the Trust Fund with respect to the Cont-ibulions will be made available to the Donors via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Cnter secure website. 6.3. The Bank shall provide 10 th - Donors, within six (6) months following the end of each Bank fiscal year, an annual single audit report, comprising (1) a management assertion together with an a testatic n from the Bank's external auditors concerning the adequacy of internal control ov -r cash-based financial reporting for all cash-based trust funds as a whole; and (2) a coinbir ed financial statement for all cash-based trust funds together with the f3ank's ext,.rnal at ditor's opinion thereon. The cost of the single audit shall be borne by the Bank. 6.4. If a Donor wishes to request, on an exceptional basis, a financial statement audit by the Bank's external audi:orr of the Trust Fund, the Donor and the Bank shall first consult as to whether such an eterr al audit is necessary. The Bank and the Donor shall agree on the appropriate score aid trms of reference of such audit. Following agreement on the scope and terms of rei2erence the Bank shall arrange for such external audit. The costs of any such audit, inclu Jing thc internal costs of the Bank with respect to such audit, shall be paid by the requesting lono r.
ï»¿-10- 6.5. The Bank shall provide thd Donors with copies of all financial statements and auditors' reports received hy the Bank from the Recipients pursuant to the Grant Agreements. 7. Progress Reporting 7.1. The Bank shall proNide the Donors with an annual report on the progress of activities financed by the Co:itributi,)ns. Within six (6) months of the final disbursement date specified in paragraph 8. 1, the 3ank shall furnish to the Donors a final report on the activities financed by the Trust Fund. 7.2 Any Donor may revie,w or (valuate activities financed by the Trust Fund. The Donor and the Bank shall a&ree on the scope and conduct of such review or evaluation, and the Bank shall provide all -elevant information within the limits of its policies and procedures. All associated costs shill be borne by the Donor. It is understood that any such review or evaluation will rot c )nstitute a financial, compliance or other audit of the Trust Fund. 8. Disbursement: Cance lat on; Refund 8.1 It is expected that the Cor tributions will be fully disbursed by the Bank by December 31, 2017. The Bank shall only disburse Contributions for the purposes of this Agreement after such date with 1 he iritten approval of the Donors. 8.2 Any Donor or the Bank ma3, upon three (3) months' prior written notice, cancel all or part of the Donor's pr) rata share, of any remaining balance of the Contributions that is not committed pursuait to ar y agreements entered into between the Bank and any consultants and/or other thi: d -arti .s for the purposes of this Agreement prior to the receipt of such notice, includ ng the irant Agreements. 8.3. Following the final disburse nent date specified in paragraph 8.1, the Bank shall return any remaining balance of the Contributions to the Donors or to the relevant Donor Balance Account on a pro lata bas [s based on the Donors' paid Contributions. In the event of a cancellation the B ink sha 11 promptly return to the relevant Donor or Donors or to the relevant Donor Balance Ac count the Donor's pro rata share of uncommitted Contributions in accordance vit 1 pa -agraph 8.2. 9. Disclosure The Bank will disclo.e t iis ) kgreement and related information on this Trust Fund in accordance with the World' B,nk "olicy on Access to Information. By entering into this Agreement, Donors consent to disc osure of this Agreement and related information on this Trust Fund.
